text:
The code used to generate the "jsp:param" tag concatinates string data with 
the "+" operator.  If the "value" parameter of this tag contains an operator 
with lower precedence the compile fails.

The following sample (with angle brackets change to parens) fails:

(jsp:forward page = "WorkItemApplet.jsp")
  (jsp:param name = "workList.id"       value = "(%= workListID %)" /)
  (jsp:param name = "workItem.id"       value = "(%= wiID %)" /)
  (jsp:param name = "open.content"      value = "(%= action.equals( \"open\" ) 
? \"true\" : \"false\" %)" /)
(/jsp:forward)
creator: craiga@mindwrap.com
nacho@apache.org
text: Please provide a simple test case...

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text: Fixed in 3.3, thanks for the report.
